title: Part D
stimulusHtml: Select a point value to view scoring criteria, solutions, and/or examples and to score the response.
descriptions:
The response does not make a claim about the area of the ocean a new species of animal has been found without functional eyes, capable of bioluminescence and able to withstand high pressure and low temperature conditions is best adapted to live in, such as any of the following:

· The organism would live in the deep ocean with no light as the darkness would not require functional eyes.

· The organism would live in the deep ocean with no light as bioluminescence would provide light.

· The animal is best adapted to the deep ocean because it is able to withstand the high pressure of the deep ocean.

· The animal is best adapted to the deep ocean because it is able to withstand the low temperatures of the deep ocean.

title: Part E
stimulusHtml: Select a point value to view scoring criteria, solutions, and/or examples and to score the response.
descriptions:
The response does not describe a government action a conservation group could advocate for that would improve a specific marine cultural ecosystem service, such as any of the following:

· Banning of coral-harming sunscreen for snorkeling tourists to maintain coral reefs for aesthetic/spiritual/religious/ecotourism/etc. use.

· Limit the number of boats allowed in certain areas at a time to maintain areas for aesthetic/spiritual/religious/ecotourism/etc. use.

· Enforce regulations regarding littering to maintain areas for aesthetic/spiritual/religious/ecotourism/etc. use.

· Educate the public/make public service announcements regarding the importance of protecting marine areas for aesthetic/spiritual/religious/ecotourism/etc. use.

title: Part I
stimulusHtml: Select a point value to view scoring criteria, solutions, and/or examples and to score the response.
descriptions:

· Any modification that would impact temperature, such as testing the same windows in a different climate or time of year, testing a different temperature difference, testing with heat/air conditioning on, etc.

· Any modification regarding the physical properties of the glass, such as testing windows of different colored glass, testing windows of different surface areas, testing triple-pane windows, etc.

title: Part J
stimulusHtml: Select a point value to view scoring criteria, solutions, and/or examples and to score the response.
descriptions:
The response does not identify the best roof color for a building located around 30 degrees latitude in the Northern Hemisphere and does not explain why the identified roof color should be used in the building design, such as the following:

· A light or white roof would reflect more solar radiation (or absorb less heat), keeping the building cooler.
